briefdescription.para: Get the maximum X position for text output.

detaileddescription.para: Retrieves the maximum number of characters that can be displayed in a line on the console (width).

ctx
The BASIC context.
The maximum X position for text output.
This function queries the console for the maximum horizontal space available to display text. It returns the number of characters that can fit in a line, allowing for accurate text positioning and wrapping.

simplesect.para: The maximum number of characters that can be displayed in a line.

briefdescription.para: Get the maximum Y position for text output.

detaileddescription.para: Retrieves the maximum number of lines that can be displayed on the console (height).

ctx
The BASIC context.
The maximum Y position for text output.
This function queries the console for the maximum vertical space available to display text. It returns the maximum number of lines that can fit on the screen before the text wraps or scrolls.

simplesect.para: The maximum number of lines that can be displayed on the console.

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the current horizontal position (column) of the cursor in the console.

detaileddescription.para: Get the current X position of the cursor.

This function queries the console for the current cursor position along the X-axis (horizontal position). It returns the current column where the cursor is located, which can be used to position or move the cursor programmatically.

simplesect.para: The current column position of the cursor.
The current X position of the cursor.

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the current vertical position (row) of the cursor in the console.

detaileddescription.para: Get the current Y position of the cursor.

This function queries the console for the current cursor position along the Y-axis (vertical position). It returns the current row where the cursor is located, allowing for precise text positioning and manipulation.

simplesect.para: The current row position of the cursor.
The current Y position of the cursor.

briefdescription.para: Retrieves a keypress from the user.

detaileddescription.para: This function waits for a keypress from the user and returns the corresponding character as a string. If no key is pressed, the function enters a wait state until a key is pressed. If the key is 255, which may indicate a timeout or no input, the function enters a "pause" state and returns an empty string.

simplesect.para: A string containing the key pressed by the user. Returns an empty string if no valid key is pressed (e.g., key value 255).

briefdescription.para: Check if the CTRL key is held down.

detaileddescription.para: Checks if the control (Ctrl) key is currently pressed.

ctx
The BASIC context.
1 if CTRL is held, 0 otherwise.
This function queries the state of the control (Ctrl) key on the keyboard. It returns a non-zero value (true) if the Ctrl key is pressed, and 0 (false) if it is not.

simplesect.para: A non-zero value if the Ctrl key is pressed, 0 otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Check if the SHIFT key is held down.

detaileddescription.para: Checks if the shift key is currently pressed.

ctx
The BASIC context.
1 if SHIFT is held, 0 otherwise.
This function queries the state of the shift key on the keyboard. It returns a non-zero value (true) if the shift key is pressed, and 0 (false) if it is not.

simplesect.para: A non-zero value if the shift key is pressed, 0 otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Check if the ALT key is held down.

detaileddescription.para: Checks if the alt key is currently pressed.

ctx
The BASIC context.
1 if ALT is held, 0 otherwise.
This function queries the state of the alt key on the keyboard. It returns a non-zero value (true) if the Alt key is pressed, and 0 (false) if it is not.

simplesect.para: A non-zero value if the Alt key is pressed, 0 otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Check if the CAPS LOCK is on.

detaileddescription.para: Checks if the Caps Lock key is currently enabled.

ctx
The BASIC context.
1 if CAPS LOCK is on, 0 otherwise.
This function queries the state of the Caps Lock key. It returns a non-zero value (true) if Caps Lock is enabled (active), and 0 (false) if it is not.

simplesect.para: A non-zero value if Caps Lock is enabled, 0 otherwise.

detaileddescription.para:
Check if input is complete yet
proc
process
true if input is still waiting for completion, false if done

briefdescription.para: Deferred cooperative input via idle process callback.

detaileddescription.para: Handle cooperative input for the INPUT statement.

When a BASIC INPUT statement is encountered, the interpreter checks whether a complete line of user input is available via kinput(). If not, the process voluntarily yields using proc_set_idle() and assigns a custom callback (check_input_in_progress) to periodically test for input readiness.

While idle, the process enters PROC_IO_BOUND state. Once the callback returns false, the scheduler resumes execution at the original line (via jump_linenum()), and input is finalised and assigned to the variable.
This mechanism ensures non-blocking interactive IO without requiring preemption, and keeps the interpreter logic readable and non-reentrant.

briefdescription.para: Clear the screen.
Move the cursor to the specified position.
Output data to the console with the PRINT statement.
Set the text foreground colour.
Set the text background colour.
Get the printable syntax of an expression in the BASIC program.

simplesect.para: The printable syntax as a string.

briefdescription.para: Load a keymap from a file.

detaileddescription.para:
Check if a key is waiting
proc
Process
true if no key is ready, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Process GET statement.

detaileddescription.para: Process GET statement to read a single keypress.
The GET statement waits for a keypress, then stores it into a variable. It behaves like INPUT but only reads a single character (without requiring ENTER).
It yields execution while no key is pressed, using the cooperative multitasking system to prevent blocking.

briefdescription.para: Waits for a given number of seconds.
BASIC console IO functions.
